replies.msg:
手動分享 致香港人的家書

[A Letter to my fellow Hongkongers]

Dear Hongkongers,

The peaceful demonstration on 9th June with over 1 million people marching has officially marked the start of the ongoing movement. The protest was initiated by the demand for a complete withdrawal of the controversial Extradition Bill and the protection for civil freedom and One Country Two Systems.

The police started firing tear gas, pepper spray, rubber bullets and using violence on 12th June. Since then, the police’s abuse of power and the use of excessive forces had only spurted. 612 and its subsequent events have led to the demands for the retraction of the “riot” characterization, the establishment of an independent commission of inquiry to investigate police brutality, the immediate exoneration of arrested protestors, and the universal suffrage for Legislative Council and Chief Executive elections.

Over the past 3 months, the government has continuously shut us down, ignored all our demands, and even defined protestors as a group with no stake in society. They shed Hong Kong in white terror, turned Hong Kong into a Police State and created a humanitarian crisis.

As we continue our fight for a liberal society, the Carrie Lam office has only fallen back towards the totalitarian era. Now, our only way out now is to keep fighting.

Fear cannot tear us down and suppression will only unite us. Hongkongers, this is our shot, let’s make history and our home a better place. Please don’t give up, have faith in yourself, have faith in us, and that our “dream” will soon come true.

Liberate Hong Kong, Revolution of Our Times!
5 Demands, Not One Less!
Stand With Hong Kong, Fight For Freedom!
Together We Stand, Together We Can!

Love,
Your fellow Hongkongers aka Family

期盼和你煲底下除罩相認、相擁，唔好放棄，香港人一個都不能少!

UPDATE

The police started firing tear gas, pepper spray, rubber bullets and using violence on 12th June. Since then, the police’s abuse of power and the use of excessive forces had only spurted. 612 and its subsequent events have led to the demands for the retraction of the “riot” characterization, the establishment of an independent commission of inquiry to investigate police brutality, the immediate exoneration of arrested protestors, and the universal suffrage for Legislative Council and Chief Executive elections.

Over the past 3 months, the government has continuously shut us down, ignored all our demands, and even defined protestors as a group with no stake in society. They shed Hong Kong in white terror, turned Hong Kong into a Police State and created a humanitarian crisis.

As we continue our fight for a liberal society, the Carrie Lam office has only fallen back towards the totalitarian era. Now, our only way out now is to keep fighting.

已有朋友及另一名手足上去實地及附近樓宇天台及樓梯搵過，並無發現

手足，如果你睇到我以下的說話，
當你感到灰心無希望的時候，請你回望你身邊，上黎連登，我地仲起度呀，你唔係自己一個嫁！

唔係因為可能會輸而放棄跑，係因為我地要全力跑，先會見到希望的曙光！

如果真係到左別無選擇的時候，我地一齊申請難民，一齊移民，一齊去其他國家睇彩虹！

一個都不能少！
